item.text: On the eighth day Moses summoned Aaron and his sons and the elders of Israel,
and said to Aaron, “Take for yourself a bull calf for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering, both flawless, and present them before the Lord.

Then <st data-num="01696" class="">tell</st> the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st>: ‘<st data-num="03947" class="">Take</st> a <st data-num="08163" class="">male</st> <st data-num="05795" class="">goat</st><n id="1" /> for a <st data-num="02403" class="">sin offering</st> and a <st data-num="05695" class="">calf</st> and a <st data-num="03532" class="">lamb</st>, both a <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st> and <st data-num="08549" class="">flawless</st>,<n id="2" /> for a <st data-num="05930" class="">burnt offering</st>,
and an ox and a ram for peace offerings to sacrifice before the Lord, and a grain offering mixed with olive oil, for today the Lord is going to appear to you.’”
So they took what Moses had commanded to the front of the Meeting Tent, and the whole congregation presented them and stood before the Lord.
Then Moses said, “This is what the Lord has commanded you to do so that the glory of the Lord may appear to you.”

Moses then said to Aaron, “Approach the altar and make your sin offering and your burnt offering, and make atonement on behalf of yourself and on behalf of the people; and also make the people’s offering and make atonement on behalf of them just as the Lord has commanded.”
So Aaron approached the altar and slaughtered the sin-offering calf which was for himself.

Then <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron’s</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> <st data-num="07126" class="">presented</st> the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him, and he <st data-num="02881" class="">dipped</st> his <st data-num="0676" class="">finger</st> in the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> and <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> it <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="07161" class="">horns</st> of the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>, and the rest of the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> he <st data-num="03332" class="">poured out</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">at</st> the <st data-num="03247" class="">base</st> of the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>.
The fat and the kidneys and the protruding lobe of the liver from the sin offering he offered up in smoke on the altar just as the Lord had commanded Moses,
but the flesh and the hide he completely burned up outside the camp.
He then slaughtered the burnt offering, and his sons handed the blood to him, and he splashed it against the altar’s sides.

The <st data-num="05930" class="">burnt offering</st> itself they <st data-num="04672" class="">handed</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him by its <st data-num="05409" class="">parts</st>, including the <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st>,<n id="2" /> and he <st data-num="06999" class="">offered</st> them <st data-num="06999" class="">up in smoke</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>,
and he washed the entrails and the legs and offered them up in smoke on top of the burnt offering on the altar.
Then he presented the people’s offering. He took the sin-offering male goat which was for the people, slaughtered it, and performed a purification rite with it like the first one.

He then <st data-num="07126" class="">presented</st> the <st data-num="05930" class="">burnt offering</st>, and <st data-num="06213" class="">did</st> it according to the <st data-num="04941" class="">standard regulation</st>.<n id="1" />

Next he <st data-num="07126" class="">presented</st> the <st data-num="04503" class="">grain offering</st>, <st data-num="04390" class="">filled</st> his <st data-num="03709" class="">hand</st> with <st data-num="04480" class="">some</st> of it, and <st data-num="06999" class="">offered</st> it <st data-num="06999" class="">up in smoke</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st> <st data-num="0905" class="">in addition to</st> the <st data-num="01242" class="">morning</st> <st data-num="05930" class="">burnt offering</st>.<n id="1" />

Then he <st data-num="07819" class="">slaughtered</st> the <st data-num="07794" class="">ox</st> and the <st data-num="0352" class="">ram</st>—the <st data-num="08002" class="">peace-offering</st> <st data-num="02077" class="">sacrifices</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> were for the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>—and <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron’s</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> <st data-num="04672" class="">handed</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him, and he <st data-num="02236" class="">splashed</st> it <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar’s</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">sides</st>.

As for the <st data-num="02459" class="">fat parts</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="07794" class="">ox</st> and <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="0352" class="">ram</st><n id="1" /> (the <st data-num="0451" class="">fatty tail</st>, the fat <st data-num="04374" class="">covering</st> the entrails,<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="03629" class="">kidneys</st>, and the <st data-num="03508" class="">protruding lobe</st> of the <st data-num="03516" class="">liver)</st>,

they<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07760" class="">set</st> <st data-num="02459" class="">those</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="02373" class="">breasts</st>, and he <st data-num="06999" class="">offered</st> the <st data-num="02459" class="">fat parts</st> <st data-num="06999" class="">up in smoke</st> on the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>.
Finally Aaron waved the breasts and the right thigh as a wave offering before the Lord just as Moses had commanded.
Then Aaron lifted up his hands toward the people and blessed them and descended from making the sin offering, the burnt offering, and the peace offering.
Moses and Aaron then entered into the Meeting Tent. When they came out, they blessed the people, and the glory of the Lord appeared to all the people.

Then fire went out from the presence of the Lord and consumed the burnt offering and the fat parts on the altar, and all the people saw it, so they shouted loudly and fell down with their faces to the ground.
